result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J Wichman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for 50 days.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason J Wichman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:51 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody,  with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat recites agreement - defendant plea to count 1 - DRI count 2.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY to count 1.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court DRI count 2.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Privat - in custody since September 1, 2014 (50 days).  No statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD and placed on probation for 3 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Pay court costs.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Court grants 50 days of sentence credit if sentence needs to be served.

Court adjourned at 1:59 p.m.
Status hearing on October 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:16 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond argument by Atty Barb Privat requests a lower cash bond.  Argument by DA Christenson - request the court deny the request for bond modification.  Court questions defendant regarding defendant's employment.  Court denies the request for bond modification.  Court requests something in writing that the defendant has ties to the community and will have employment if released from custody, upon receipt Atty Privat can file a motion to have the matter addressed again.

Court adjourned at 1:19 p.m.
Motion hearing on September 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:16 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat indicates the preliminary hearing will be waived - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Attorney Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing to be scheduled.

Court adjourned at 1:19 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

2:58 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present via video from Green Lake County Jail with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  

Court orders bond set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions of:    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Attorney Privat requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled.  Court will set for preliminary hearing within the next ten days - tentatively looking at September 9, 2014.

Court adjourned at 3:02 p.m.
